Description: The Jacopo Bellini album: The Flight into Egypt with St Joseph leading the donkey on which are mounted the Virgin Mary riding side saddle carrying the Christ Child, two men and two women walking alongside, the composition continued to the left-hand page of the opening, 1855,0811.28 verso Leadpoint, a white ground (? bone dust or chalk) applied with a brush to the face of the woman to the right of the Virgin, and an area around the chest of the Virgin and ? around neck of donkey to define his halter Verso: Nude women and children; one woman reclining, the composition continued from the right-hand page of the opening, 1855,0811.30 recto Leadpoint
Curator's comments: Watermark: encircled scales. See 1855,0811.1 for a description of the volume. Lit.: C. Eisler, 'The Genius of Jacopo Bellini', New York, 1989, pls 180 (recto) and 69 (verso), Appendix B as 30r and v
Bibliographic references: Popham & Pouncey 1950 / The Fourteenth and Fifteenth Centuries (21)
Eisler 1989 / The Genius of Jacopo Bellini : The Complete Paintings and Drawings (App.B.1(30))
Degenhardt & Schmidt 1968 continuing / Corpus der italienischen Zeichnungen 1300-1450 (721)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Anna Bellini (?; will, 25 Nov. 1471)
Previous owner/ex-collection: Gentile Bellini (?; will, 18 Feb. 1507)
Previous owner/ex-collection: Marco Cornaro, Bishop of Vicenza
